snippet: MANGINO--Joseph M.,passed away on March 17, 2015 at age 87. Graduate of St. Peter's High School, Staten Island, Kings Point Merchant Marine Academy in 1947, and New York Law School in 1956. U.S. Navy Veteran of WWII and Korean War, active in the Naval Reserves, retiring as Commander. Served as Deputy Commissioner of New York Motor Vehicles, admiralty law attorney as Hill, Rivkins LLP senior partner, and New York Board of Education Retirement System counsel, retiring to Virginia Beach in 1992. Survived by his widow Toni Gerritse, three children, Julie, physician in Columbus, OH, Michael, risk manager at BP in Chicago, Stephen, deputy division chief at DTRA in DC, their mother, Constance D. Preston, and a brother, Thomas in Shelton, CT. Interment at Arlington National Cemetery on May 9, 2016 at 11am. 1/3
lead_paragraph: MANGINO--Joseph M.,passed away on March 17, 2015 at age 87. Graduate of St. Peter's High School, Staten Island, Kings Point Merchant Marine Academy in 1947, and New York Law School in 1956. U.S. Navy Veteran of WWII and Korean War, active in the Naval Reserves, retiring as Commander. Served as Deputy Commissioner of New York Motor Vehicles, admiralty law attorney as Hill, Rivkins LLP senior partner, and New York Board of Education Retirement System counsel, retiring to Virginia Beach in 1992. Survived by his widow Toni Gerritse, three children, Julie, physician in Columbus, OH, Michael, risk manager at BP in Chicago, Stephen, deputy division chief at DTRA in DC, their mother, Constance D. Preston, and a brother, Thomas in Shelton, CT. Interment at Arlington National Cemetery on May 9, 2016 at 11am. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Memorials  MANGINO, JOSEPH M.
